required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BAY63-2521 - Long-term Extension Study in Patients With Chronic Thromboembolic Pulmonary Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: Long-term Extension, Multicentre, Multi-international Study to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of Oral BAY63-2521 (1mg, 1.5 mg, 2.0 mg, 2.5 mg Tid) in Patients With Chronic Thromboembolic Pulmonary Hypertension (CTEPH).

brief_summary.textblock: Patients who have completed the 16 weeks treatment of the CHEST-1 trial (study number 11348) will be asked to participate in this long term extension study with BAY63-2521. The aim of the long term study is to collect additional information to evaluate the safety and tolerability of BAY63-2521. Patients will be treated with open label medication on their individual optimal dose between 0,5 mg - 2,5 mg tid.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From administration of first dose of study medication up to 2 days after end of treatment with study medication, up to 10 years
primary_outcome.description: Analyses of drug-related TEAEs were based on the assessment of causal relationship to study medication.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to end of safety follow-up visit, up to 10 years (1 month more than End of study visit)
primary_outcome.description: Analyses of deaths were based on the assessment of causal relationship to study medication. The safety follow-up visit was to be performed 30 days after the last dose of riociguat.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-emergent High Laboratory Abnormalities in Hematology and Coagulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Termination visit, up to 10 years
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of participants only with a treatment-emergent shift in hematology and coagulation parameters from normal or low at baseline to a high value at a timepoint after the start of treatment. A termination visit was only to be performed in the case of premature termination of study medication or if the sponsor announced the official end of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-emergent Low Laboratory Abnormalities in Hematology and Coagulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Termination visit, up to 10 years
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of participants only with a treatment-emergent shift in hematology and coagulation parameters from normal or high at baseline to a low value at a timepoint after the start of treatment. A termination visit was only to be performed in the case of premature termination of study medication or if the sponsor announced the official end of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline of Hemoglobin in Hematology and Coagulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Termination visit, up to 10 years
secondary_outcome.description: Hemoglobin is standard Hematology and coagulation parameter. A termination visit was only to be performed in the case of premature termination of study medication or if the sponsor announced the official end of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-emergent High Laboratory Abnormalities in Clinical Chemistry
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Termination visit, up to 10 years
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of participants per treatment group only with a treatment-emergent shift in clinical chemistry parameters from normal or low at baseline to a high value at a timepoint after the start of treatment. A termination visit was only to be performed in the case of premature termination of study medication or if the sponsor announced the official end of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-emergent Low Laboratory Abnormalities in Clinical Chemistry
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Termination visit, up to 10 years
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of participants per treatment group only with a treatment-emergent shift in clinical chemistry parameters from normal or high at baseline to a low value at a timepoint after the start of treatment. A termination visit was only to be performed in the case of premature termination of study medication or if the sponsor announced the official end of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline of Urate in Clinical Chemistry
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Termination visit, up to 10 years
secondary_outcome.description: Urate is standard clinical chemistry parameter. A termination visit was only to be performed in the case of premature termination of study medication or if the sponsor announced the official end of the study.

other_outcome.measure: Change of Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP)
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Termination visit, up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: SBP was measured after the participant had been at rest for 10 minutes in a supine position. Low SBP was defined as SBP <95 mmHg, normal SBP as SBP 95-140mmHg, and high SBP as SBP >140 mmHg. A termination visit was only to be performed in the case of premature termination of study medication or if the sponsor announced the official end of the study.

other_outcome.measure: Change of Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP)
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Termination visit, up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: DBP was measured after the participants had been at rest for 10 minutes in a supine position. A termination visit was only to be performed in the case of premature termination of study medication or if the sponsor announced the official end of the study.

other_outcome.measure: Change of Heart Rate
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Termination visit, up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: Heart rate was measured after the participant had been at rest for 10 minutes in a supine position. A termination visit was only to be performed in the case of premature termination of study medication or if the sponsor announced the official end of the study.

other_outcome.measure: Change of Weight
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Termination visit, up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: Weight was evaluated for safety. A termination visit was only to be performed in the case of premature termination of study medication or if the sponsor announced the official end of the study.

other_outcome.measure: Change of Oxygen Saturation (SaO2)
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Termination visit, up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: SaO2 is one parameters of blood gas. The sample was obtained with the participant resting in a sitting or supine position for at least 10 minutes. A termination visit was only to be performed in the case of premature termination of study medication or if the sponsor announced the official end of the study.

other_outcome.measure: Change of Arterial Partial Oxygen Pressure (PaO2)
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Termination visit, up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: PaO2 is one parameter of blood gas. The sample was obtained with the participant resting in a sitting or supine position for at least 10 minutes. A termination visit was only to be performed in the case of premature termination of study medication or if the sponsor announced the official end of the study.

other_outcome.measure: Change of Arterial Partial Pressure of Carbon Dioxide (PaCO2)
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Termination visit, up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: PaCO2 is one parameter of blood gas. The sample was obtained with the participant resting in a sitting or supine position for at least 10 minutes. A termination visit was only to be performed in the case of premature termination of study medication or if the sponsor announced the official end of the study.

other_outcome.measure: Change of RR Duration From Electrocardiogram (ECG)
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Month 48
other_outcome.description: Heart rate from ECG is derived from the RR duration, unless arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation or ventricular extra beats require additional calculations. ECGs were recorded after the participant had been at rest for 15 minutes in a supine position. Analyses up to Month 48. After this timepoint, data was available for considerably fewer participants in the analysis set.

other_outcome.measure: Change of PR Duration From ECG
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Month 48
other_outcome.description: PR duration was evaluated as part of ECG. ECGs were recorded after the participant had been at rest for 15 minutes in a supine position. Analyses up to Month 48. After this timepoint, data was available for considerably fewer participants in the analysis set.

other_outcome.measure: Change of QRS Duration From ECG
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Month 48
other_outcome.description: QRS duration was evaluated as part of ECG. ECGs were recorded after the participant had been at rest for 15 minutes in a supine position. Analyses up to Month 48. After this timepoint, data was available for considerably fewer participants in the analysis set.

other_outcome.measure: Change of QT Duration in ECG
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Month 48
other_outcome.description: QT duration was evaluated as part of ECG. ECGs were recorded after the participant had been at rest for 15 minutes in a supine position. Analyses up to Month 48. After this timepoint, data was available for considerably fewer participants in the analysis set.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Six-minute Walking Distance (6MWD) Test
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to End of study visit, up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: 6MWD is exercise testing and is one of efficacy evaluation

other_outcome.measure: Change in Pulmonary Vascular Resistance (PVR)
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Month 45 and Month 48
other_outcome.description: Pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) was measured only if right-heart catheterization was performed as part of a regular diagnostic work-up. Analyses up to Month 48 due to limited data.

other_outcome.measure: Change in N-terminal Prohormone of Brain Natriuretic Peptide (NT-proBNP)
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to End of study visit, up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: NT-proBNP levels in the blood are used for diagnosis of acute congestive heart failure (CHF) and may be useful to establish prognosis in heart failure

other_outcome.measure: Change in World Health Organization (WHO) Functional Class
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to End of study visit, up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: WHO classification: I: Participants with PH. Ordinary physical activity does not cause undue dyspnea or fatigue, chest pain, or near syncope. II: Participants with PH are comfortable at rest. Ordinary physical activity causes undue dyspnea or fatigue, chest pain, or near syncope. III: Participants with PH are comfortable at rest. Less than ordinary activity causes undue dyspnea or fatigue, chest pain, or near syncope. IV: Participants with PH with inability to carry out any physical activity. They manifest signs of right-heart failure. Dyspnea and/or fatigue may even be present at rest. For class change from baseline, minus indicates a participant's functional class decreased compared with baseline (e.g. "-1" indicates a participant changed from class IV to class III, or from class II to class I), plus indicates a participant's functional class increased compared with baseline (e.g. "+1" indicates a participant changed from class I to class II, or from class III to class IV).

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinical Worsening
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to End of study visit, up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: Time to clinical worsening was a parameter that combined death and events reflective of persistent clinical worsening of the participant's underlying diagnosis of pulmonary hypertension (PH).

other_outcome.measure: Incidence of Clinical Worsening Events Per 100 Person Years
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to End of study visit, up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: Time to clinical worsening was a parameter that combined death and events reflective of persistent clinical worsening of the participant's underlying diagnosis of pulmonary hypertension (PH).

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Borg CR 10 Scale
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Week 12
other_outcome.description: The Borg CR10 Scale was measured in conjunction with the 6MWD test. The test was explained to the participant before starting the 6MWD test. Participants were asked to rank their exertion at the end of the 6MWD test. Low values indicate low levels of exertion; high values indicate more intense exertion reported by the participant. The score ranges from 0 ("Nothing at all") to 10 ("Extremely strong - Maximal").

other_outcome.measure: Change in Score of EQ-5D Questionnaire
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to End of study visit, up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: The EQ-5D is a standardized instrument for use as a measure of health outcome. The EQ-5D is a self report questionnaire. The utility score is calculated based on five questions concerning problems with mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression. An increase in the utility score represents an improvement in quality of life. The score ranges from -0.594 (worst answer in all five questions) to 1 (best answer in all five questions).

other_outcome.measure: Change in Score of Living With Pulmonary Hypertension (LPH) Questionnaire
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to End of study visit, up to 10 years
other_outcome.description: The LPH questionnaire is designed to measure the effects of PH and PH-specific treatments on an individual's quality of life. The LPH is a self-report questionnaire and was completed by the participant. The LPH total score can range from 0 (best) to 105 (worst).

intervention.description: BAY63-2521 - 1 mg tid - 2,5 mg tid orally until end of study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have completed 16 weeks of treatment in the double blind trial CHEST 1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have an ongoing serious adverse event from CHEST 1 that is assessed as related to BAY63-2521 are not allowed to participate in the extension trial

facility.name: Centro Hospitalar de Lisboa Norte - Hospital Santa Maria

link.description: Click here to find information about studies related to Bayer Healthcare products conducted in Europe
Click here to find results for studies related to Bayer products

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Study was conducted at 71 centers in 25 countries or regions, between 01-JUL-2009 (first participant first visit) and 19-AUG-2019 (last participant last visit)
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 243 participants who completed CHEST-1 (NCT00855465), 237 entered CHEST-2. 155 participants were from the former riociguat treatment group, and 82 were from the former placebo group.

group.title: Riociguat-Former Riociguat 1.0-2.5 mg
group.description: Participants were from the former riociguat (BAY 63-2521) treatment group of CHEST-1 on the same dose as they received on the last day of CHEST-1.

group.title: Riociguat-Former Placebo
group.description: Participants were from the former placebo group of CHEST-1. The starting dose in CHEST-2 was 1.0 mg riociguat three times one day.

baseline.population: All 237 participants who completed 16 weeks of treatment in the double-blind CHEST-1 study entered long term extension CHEST-2 study. Baseline of CHEST-2 was Week 0 of CHEST-1. All 237 participants were included in the long-term safety set

group.title: Riociguat-Former Riociguat 1.0-2.5 mg
group.description: Participants were from the former riociguat (BAY 63-2521) treatment group of CHEST-1 on the same dose as they received on the last day of CHEST-1.

group.title: Riociguat-Former Placebo
group.description: Participants were from the former placebo group of CHEST-1. The starting dose in CHEST-2 was 1.0 mg riociguat three times one day.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Change of Oxygen Saturation (SaO2)
measure.description: SaO2 is one parameters of blood gas. The sample was obtained with the participant resting in a sitting or supine position for at least 10 minutes. A termination visit was only to be performed in the case of premature termination of study medication or if the sponsor announced the official end of the study.
measure.population: Participants in SAF with evaluable data for each visit

outcome.title: Change of RR Duration From Electrocardiogram (ECG)
outcome.description: Heart rate from ECG is derived from the RR duration, unless arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation or ventricular extra beats require additional calculations. ECGs were recorded after the participant had been at rest for 15 minutes in a supine position. Analyses up to Month 48. After this timepoint, data was available for considerably fewer participants in the analysis set.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Month 48
outcome.population: Participants in SAF with evaluable data for each visit

outcome.description: NT-proBNP levels in the blood are used for diagnosis of acute congestive heart failure (CHF) and may be useful to establish prognosis in heart failure

class.title: Change from baseline to End of study visit

outcome.title: Change in World Health Organization (WHO) Functional Class
outcome.description: WHO classification: I: Participants with PH. Ordinary physical activity does not cause undue dyspnea or fatigue, chest pain, or near syncope. II: Participants with PH are comfortable at rest. Ordinary physical activity causes undue dyspnea or fatigue, chest pain, or near syncope. III: Participants with PH are comfortable at rest. Less than ordinary activity causes undue dyspnea or fatigue, chest pain, or near syncope. IV: Participants with PH with inability to carry out any physical activity. They manifest signs of right-heart failure. Dyspnea and/or fatigue may even be present at rest. For class change from baseline, minus indicates a participant's functional class decreased compared with baseline (e.g. "-1" indicates a participant changed from class IV to class III, or from class II to class I), plus indicates a participant's functional class increased compared with baseline (e.g. "+1" indicates a participant changed from class I to class II, or from class III to class IV).
outcome.time_frame: From baseline to End of study visit, up to 10 years
outcome.population: Participants in SAF with evaluable data for each visit

group.title: Riociguat-Former Riociguat 1.0-2.5 mg
group.description: Participants were from the former riociguat (BAY 63-2521) treatment group of CHEST-1 on the same dose as they received on the last day of CHEST-1.

group.title: Riociguat-Former Placebo
group.description: Participants were from the former placebo group of CHEST-1. The starting dose in CHEST-2 was 1.0 mg riociguat three times one day.

measure.title: Change in World Health Organization (WHO) Functional Class
measure.description: WHO classification: I: Participants with PH. Ordinary physical activity does not cause undue dyspnea or fatigue, chest pain, or near syncope. II: Participants with PH are comfortable at rest. Ordinary physical activity causes undue dyspnea or fatigue, chest pain, or near syncope. III: Participants with PH are comfortable at rest. Less than ordinary activity causes undue dyspnea or fatigue, chest pain, or near syncope. IV: Participants with PH with inability to carry out any physical activity. They manifest signs of right-heart failure. Dyspnea and/or fatigue may even be present at rest. For class change from baseline, minus indicates a participant's functional class decreased compared with baseline (e.g. "-1" indicates a participant changed from class IV to class III, or from class II to class I), plus indicates a participant's functional class increased compared with baseline (e.g. "+1" indicates a participant changed from class I to class II, or from class III to class IV).
measure.population: Participants in SAF with evaluable data for each visit

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Clinical Worsening
outcome.description: Time to clinical worsening was a parameter that combined death and events reflective of persistent clinical worsening of the participant's underlying diagnosis of pulmonary hypertension (PH).

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Borg CR 10 Scale
outcome.description: The Borg CR10 Scale was measured in conjunction with the 6MWD test. The test was explained to the participant before starting the 6MWD test. Participants were asked to rank their exertion at the end of the 6MWD test. Low values indicate low levels of exertion; high values indicate more intense exertion reported by the participant. The score ranges from 0 ("Nothing at all") to 10 ("Extremely strong - Maximal").
outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Week 12
outcome.population: Participants in SAF with evaluable data for each visit

group.title: Riociguat-Former Riociguat 1.0-2.5 mg
group.description: Participants were from the former riociguat (BAY 63-2521) treatment group of CHEST-1 on the same dose as they received on the last day of CHEST-1.

group.title: Riociguat-Former Placebo
group.description: Participants were from the former placebo group of CHEST-1. The starting dose in CHEST-2 was 1.0 mg riociguat three times one day.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Borg CR 10 Scale
measure.description: The Borg CR10 Scale was measured in conjunction with the 6MWD test. The test was explained to the participant before starting the 6MWD test. Participants were asked to rank their exertion at the end of the 6MWD test. Low values indicate low levels of exertion; high values indicate more intense exertion reported by the participant. The score ranges from 0 ("Nothing at all") to 10 ("Extremely strong - Maximal").
measure.population: Participants in SAF with evaluable data for each visit

outcome.title: Change in Score of EQ-5D Questionnaire
outcome.description: The EQ-5D is a standardized instrument for use as a measure of health outcome. The EQ-5D is a self report questionnaire. The utility score is calculated based on five questions concerning problems with mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression. An increase in the utility score represents an improvement in quality of life. The score ranges from -0.594 (worst answer in all five questions) to 1 (best answer in all five questions).
outcome.time_frame: From baseline to End of study visit, up to 10 years
outcome.population: Participants in SAF with evaluable data for each visit

group.title: Riociguat-Former Riociguat 1.0-2.5 mg
group.description: Participants were from the former riociguat (BAY 63-2521) treatment group of CHEST-1 on the same dose as they received on the last day of CHEST-1.

group.title: Riociguat-Former Placebo
group.description: Participants were from the former placebo group of CHEST-1. The starting dose in CHEST-2 was 1.0 mg riociguat three times one day.

measure.title: Change in Score of EQ-5D Questionnaire
measure.description: The EQ-5D is a standardized instrument for use as a measure of health outcome. The EQ-5D is a self report questionnaire. The utility score is calculated based on five questions concerning problems with mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression. An increase in the utility score represents an improvement in quality of life. The score ranges from -0.594 (worst answer in all five questions) to 1 (best answer in all five questions).
measure.population: Participants in SAF with evaluable data for each visit

class.title: Change from baseline to EOS Visit

outcome.title: Change in Score of Living With Pulmonary Hypertension (LPH) Questionnaire
outcome.description: The LPH questionnaire is designed to measure the effects of PH and PH-specific treatments on an individual's quality of life. The LPH is a self-report questionnaire and was completed by the participant. The LPH total score can range from 0 (best) to 105 (worst).
outcome.time_frame: From baseline to End of study visit, up to 10 years
outcome.population: Participants in SAF with evaluable data for each visit

measure.population: Participants in SAF with evaluable data for each visit

reported_events.time_frame: From administration of first dose of study medication up to 2 days after end of treatment with study medication, up to 10 years.

group.title: Former Riociguat 1.0-2.5 mg
group.description: Subjects from the riociguat 1.0-2.5 mg group of CHEST-1 entered the extension study(CHEST-2) with the same dose as they received on the last day of CHEST-1 (Visit7).

group.title: Former Placebo
group.description: Subjects from the placebo group of CHEST-1 entered the extension study (CHEST-2),the starting dose in CHEST-2 was 1.0 mg riociguat tid.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
